entry.title: Functional area derivation using custom logic in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Functional areas in SAP S/4HANA Cloud are organizational units used for classifying expenses by their nature rather than by operational or geographical divisions. They serve as a key component in cost-of-sales accounting and enable businesses to prepare segmental financial statements for compliance and decision-making purposes. The derivation of functional areas is determined based on the sequence as explained here. In this short blog post, I would like to cover a practical example of how the functional area derivation works using a custom logic substitution rule, which is the last sequence step of the derivation logic. In this demo example, the use case is that the derivation should take place only for the company code 0800, and the default functional area will be substituted by a target functional area which is entered in a custom field of a professional services customer project. The prerequisite is creating and enabling the custom field YY1_Functional_Area_WP_cpd  in the business context "Work Package".

Step 1:

Create a custom logic implementation for the Extension Point FIN_CODING_BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION

Add the following code: in this example, if the Company Code 0800 is used, the custom logic will substitute the default functional area with the functional area entered by the user into the custom field.

* Note: please always copy the values from input to output first before

* any substitutions, otherwise, the initial values from the output will

* be used for substitutions!!

    MOVE-CORRESPONDING codingblockitem TO codingblockitemout.

 

DATA lv_project_target_fa type STRING.

*Only valid for customer projects, as the custom field is created in this context

IF codingblockitem-companycode = '0800'.

    SELECT YY1_Functional_Area_WP_cpd FROM I_WORKPACKAGE

    INTO _project_target_fa

    WHERE WORKPACKAGE = @codingblockitem-wbselementexternalid.

    ENDSELECT.

    "If the custom field value if empty, no substitution

    If  lv_project_target_fa IS INITIAL.

        EXIT.

    ELSE.

        codingblockitemout-functionalarea = lv_project_target_fa.

        substitutiondone = abap_true.

    ENDIF.

ENDIF.

Step 2:

Next, create the substitution rule for this custom logic to be executed. In the “Manage Substitution/Validation Rules – Journal Entries” app, create a new rule for the business context Coding Block as follows:

 

The precondition determines in which cases the substitution rule will be triggered – in our demo use case, we want the rule to trigger only when the source functional area is equal to 'YB25'. The substitution rule itself simply maps the target field value to the value of the source field functional area (which will be set to a new value during the runtime of the custom logic). So essentially, if the customer project custom field has a target functional area 'YB24' maintained, the default functional area YB25 will be replaced by 'YB24'.

Once this is done, we can conduct a quick test to validate the result. The default functional area determined is YB25, and for our test project XDT0031, the custom field has been maintained with YB24 as the target functional area. After completing a test time booking for the project, the derivation result can be successfully validated in the "Display Line Items in General Ledger" app:

entry.title: Cloud BAdI to Update Sales Order in Finalize Phase
entry.content:
Cloud BAdI to Update Sales Order in Finalize Phase

As I explained in blog Sales Document BAdI Overview, there are limited sales document fields can be modified via custom logic in BAdI due to various reasons. On the other hand, we are receiving customer requirements to update sales document standard fields via custom logic to control standard business processes. It is a journey to enhance extensibility in sales document processes to better fulfill business requirements. 

Here I am happy to announce a new Cloud BAdI will be introduced in CE2508 which allows customers to modify custom fields and certain standard fields in sales document finalize phase before save. Please find detail information in https://api.sap.com/badi/SD_SLS_FINALIZE.

Why New BAdI?

As there are already many Cloud BAdIs available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, I am often asked why a new BAdI should be introduced rather than reusing existing ones. Here are some considerations we received from customers and partners regarding our existing Cloud BAdIs:

  • In transactional BAdIs like SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD or SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM, customer can only access partial sales document information. For example, customers cannot access schedule line data from BAdI SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD. If a customer wants to use schedule line data to update custom field at the sales document header level, this cannot be achieved by implementing custom logic in BAdI SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD. 
  • The BAdI import parameter is not stable and reliable in transactional BAdIs like SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD or SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM, as these BAdIs are called multiple times during sales document processing. 
  • In automatic channels that do not involve user interaction, transactional BAdIs are not the best option for influencing the sales document process. Instead, the BAdIs that are processed only once during document saving are more suitable for handling such use cases. For example, the SD_SLS_CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE BAdI is only called during the save process. 
  • The BAdI import parameter is more stable in finalize phase BAdIs like SD_SLS_CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE, and all sales document entities are accessible via this BAdI. However, it is not possible to update any sales document data in this BAdI as it was was only defined to check the sales document before saving. 

Definition of New Cloud BAdI

To address the demands from customers and partners, a new BAdI, SD_SLS_FINALIZE, has been introduced to update the sales document data during the finalize phase before save. This new Cloud BAdI has following aspects:

  • The import parameters are more reliable because this BAdI is processed during sales document save phase
  • All sales document entities are accessible through this BAdI 
  • Custom fields on both sales document header and item can be modified via this BAdI
  • Certain standard fields can be modified via this BAdI, such as the rejection reason code at the line item level

Let's take a closer look at the details of new Cloud BAdI SD_SLS_FINALIZE. 

BAdI Parameters

Following import parameters are defined in this BAdI so that customer can access those entities:

  • sales document header
  • sales document header partners
  • sales document items
  • sales document item partners
  • sales document schedule lines

Following changing parameters are defined in this BAdI so that customer can modify sales document data:

  • custom fields on sales document header level
  • custom fields on sales document item level
  • rejection reason code on sales document item
  • control fields to indicate what field is modified 

Business Example 

I'd like to use a business example to explain how this BAdI fulfills a business requirement. 

Supplier company XYZ sells products to different customers via portal. When customers place orders in the supplier portal, the OData API is called to create sales orders. The order creation process in supplier company XYZ is fully automatic. Only in exceptional cases sales experts will manually operate the sales order through the sales order UI. 

Due to fluctuations in the prices of raw materials, company XYZ generally does not accept customer orders with long-term delivery requests. To ensure financial risk is under control, system shall automatically reject customer orders requested to be delivered later than 1 month.  

Solution via Extensibility

The sales document finalize BAdI is the best option to handle this use case, as the finalize BAdI SD_SLS_FINALIZE works across all sales document processing channels. It is ideally suited for handling the automatic order creation scenario from supplier company XYZ. 

Define Reject Reason Code

Go to SSCUI 102494 to define a new rejection reason code for long-term delivery request. 

This reject reason code will be used in the BAdI implementation when customer requested delivery date is in 30 days away. 

BAdI Implementation

Open the app "Custom Logic" and create a BAdI implementation for BAdI SD_SLS_FINALIZE.

Implement following ABAP code and then publish the BAdI implementation. 

* Set the rejection reason to sales order item when customer requested delivery date is
* 30 days away
  if salesdocument-salesdocumenttype = 'TA' and salesdocument-salesorganization = '1010'.
    "check is customer requested delivery date is more than 30 days from today
    if salesdocument-requesteddeliverydate - salesdocument-creationdate > 30.
      loop at salesdocumentitems_change assigning field-symbol(<ls_item_change>).
        <ls_item_change>-salesdocumentrjcnreason = 'Z1'.
        <ls_item_change>-control-salesdocumentrjcnreason = abap_true.
      endloop.
    endif.
  endif.

Test Sales Order via UI

Create a sales order in Fiori application and set the requested delivery date within 30 days. 

Add the item and save the order. System shows nothing is rejected.

Create a new sales order and set the requested delivery date in November. 

Add items and save the sales order. 

After the sales order is saved, both sales order items are rejected with the rejection reason code 'Z1' which was set in BAdI implementation logic.

Go to status view and system indicates all items are rejected.

Test Order Creation via OData API

Call sales order A2X OData API to create a sales order. In the OData API payload, the requested delivery date is set on September 10th which is within 30 days period. 

The sales order 23311 is created via OData call. Go to system to check if line item is rejected in this sales order. 

Then create a new sales order via OData API call, and set the requested delivery to November 10th which is out of 30 days period. 

Open the sales order 23313 and check if line item is rejected automatically. 

Test Order Simulation via OData API

Order simulation via API call is also important for customer's business scenario. Since the sales document finalize BAdI is called in all sales document processing channels, using custom logic to reject line item in order simulation is also possible. 

Call sales order A2X OData simulation API to simulate the order creation and set the requested delivery date to November 10th which is out of 30 days period.

Check the OData simulation response in the right panel, the sales document item rejection fields are updated based on BAdI logic. 

Moving Forward

The sales document finalize BAdI will be helpful in fulfilling various business use cases to influence sales document processes. Currently, this BAdI is only available for sales orders and sales orders without charge. 

In the future, based on customer requirements, this BAdI will be enhanced to support more sales document types and allow the modification of additional standard fields. Please feel free to submit your requirement through the Customer Influence Portal to help us prioritize our product roadmap.

entry.title: How to use key-user in-app Custom Logic extensibility to change eDocument currency in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
Introduction

Some countries (like Colombia) might required to have reports sent to fiscal authority on their local currency even if the transaction was executed in a different currency and is registered on the system in a foreign currency. On  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition this requirement might be delivered in some localizations via extensibility as a localization as a Self-service to be implemented during implementation project.

Below example, shows how a sale in USD would be reported without the extensibility (left) and with extensibility solution (right):

Solution through Extensibility 

Based on a demand for Colombia invoice eDocument, we have developed the KBA 3648968.

On the KBA, we instruct how to find extension points (BAdIs) to change information in eDocument generated via eDocument Cockpit or Manage Electronic Documents apps. We also highlight that for each localization, it should be consulted the SAP Help Portal documentation for that localization to check which extension points are available and which should be used.

We also provide a proof-of-concept sample code that shows how the change for a XML file created for an eDocument for Colombia can be changed. Note that each localization and eDocument likely will have different extension points and limitation as well as each implementation might have its own requirements that will result on complete different code.

So each implementation should develop its own code and the KBA code is only an example and do not cover all scenarios nor is a final solution to be implemented.

Important Assets

The following documentation might be helpful to obtain more detailed information:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

    • SAP KBA 2805847 - eDocument Colombia Troubleshooting Guide (Topic B103)
    • SAP KBA 3648968 - Currency issues and Extensibility in Colombia eDocuments - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • SAP KBA 2974488 - Calculation errors in CUFE
    • SAP Help Portal:  Colombia App Extensibility
    • SAP Help Portal: Country/Region-Specific Functions
    • SAP Help Portal: Creating Implementations

entry.title: Create Professional Service Projects via APIs
entry.content:
Business Requirement

We met a requirement from S/4HANA Public Cloud Customer. They'd like business process involves integrating from an OA system into S/4HANA Cloud to create a professional service project.

System Implementation

The professional service project is set up step by step using the standard API Overview | Commercial Project - Create, Update | SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

1. Configure Communication Arrangement
Communication arrangement Commercial Project Integration (SAP_COM_0054) is established.

2. POST Method - /ProjectSet: Create Customer Project

Payload Example:

{
  "ProjectCategory": "C",
  "OrgID": "1010",
  "CostCenter": "0010101902",
  "ProfitCenter": "YB101",
  "Customer": "10100002",
  "ProjectID": "CHEN0806",
  "ProjectStage": "P001",
  "Currency": "EUR",
  "StartDate": "2025-08-01T00:00:00",
  "EndDate": "2025-09-30T00:00:00",
  "ProjectName": "CHEN0806",

  "ProjManagerExtId": "I532094",
  "ProjManagerCompCode": "1010",
  "RestrictTimePosting": "Y",
  "UseProjectBilling": "X",
  "Confidential": "N"
}

After successfully executing the API, the system produces the following result: customer project CHEN0806 basic header information is successfully created.

3. POST Method - /WorkPackageSet: Create Project Work Package

entry.title: 关于S/4HANA拓展性：你所需要知道的一切
entry.content:
本文内容来自 SAP S/4HANA Extensibility: All You Need to Know ，目的是帮助您理解如何拓展S/4 HANA

如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

这篇博客 文章是SAP S/4HANA扩展性相关资料链接的集合，按主题分组。

（注：为简便起见，我将SAP S/4HANA（本地部署）和SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition简写为OP/PCE）

这篇博客文章分为6个部分：

  • 1. 获取扩展性概念的概述
  • 2. 关键用户扩展性
  • 3. 开发人员扩展性（又称SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP环境或"嵌入式Steampunk"）
  • 4. 经典扩展性
  • 5. SAP BTP，ABAP环境（又称"Steampunk"）
  • 6. SAP BTP：其他环境

这篇博客文章于2022年10月完全重写，以反映开发人员扩展性（"SAP S/4HANA Cloud，ABAP环境"或"嵌入式Steampunk"）的发布。2023年6月我添加了"ABAP Cloud"的内容。2024年，我更改了博客的标题（我去掉了"学习旅程"这个术语，因为这是SAP官方学习资料使用的），并包含了SAP Build和SAP Build Code等主题。

作为一个小声明，我想指出，这篇博客文章专注于基于ABAP的扩展性选项。这是因为ABAP在我的舒适区内，我想把SAP BTP上其他扩展性选项的主题留给这个领域的专家。 请注意，这是特定文档和资源链接的集合。请不要在本文档的评论部分提问，而是参考具体的文档或社区，在那里询问关于特定扩展任务和工具的问题！

1. 获取扩展性概念的概述

作为第一步，获得对SAP S/4HANA扩展性概念的基本了解。

扩展性概念的基本构建模块是：

  • "体内"扩展性，使用：
    • 关键用户扩展性工具
    • 开发人员扩展性（又称SAP S/4HANA Cloud，ABAP环境或"嵌入式Steampunk"，随SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2208和SAP S/4HANA 2022引入）
    • 经典扩展性（又称经典ABAP自定义开发）
  • 使用SAP BTP的并行扩展性：
    • 使用SAP Build在SAP BTP上创建的低代码扩展
    • 使用SAP Build Code在SAP BTP上开发的扩展，使用SAP BTP环境和服务，如Java或Node.JS
    • SAP BTP ABAP环境

为了理解扩展性概念，我推荐：

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud的干净核心扩展性（2024）
  • 专注于ABAP的白皮书《使用基于ABAP的扩展在云端和本地扩展SAP S/4HANA》（2024年更新）

白皮书还包括何时使用哪种扩展性选项的建议。

ABAP Cloud是构建云就绪业务应用程序、服务和扩展的ABAP开发模型。它涵盖了SAP BTP和SAP S/4HANA的开发者和关键用户扩展性，适用于公有云、私有云和本地部署。

要了解ABAP Cloud，请阅读我同事的博客，即《ABAP Cloud》和《ABAP Cloud – 它包含什么？》作为起点。

SAP应用程序扩展方法论提供了评估客户扩展用例和以结构化、正式化方式定义扩展目标解决方案的方法论。它为客户和合作伙伴提供了结构化、技术无关的方法来定义组织特定的扩展策略。它涵盖了"干净核心"、"云就绪性"和"面向未来"等挑战。

知识来源： 在以下部分中，我提供了来自这些知识来源的特定文档的其他链接：

  • Communities:
    • ABAP Development:  ABAP Development | SAP Community
    • ABAP Extensibility: ABAP Extensibility | SAP Community
    • Embedded Steampunk and 3-Tier: SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment | SAP Community
  • SAP S/4HANA Extensibility Explorer: SAP Extensibility Explorer 
  • Leaning Journeys: Learning Journeys - Overview (sap.com)
  • Tutorials: https://developers.sap.com/tutorial-navigator.html
  • Product Documentation: SAP S/4HANA Cloud | SAP Help Portal ; SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Help Portal, SAP S/4HANA | SAP Help Portal
  • SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  (Filter: Workstreams – Extensibility)
  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub: SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Latest TechEd Sessions:
    • DT201 | Extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    • DT200 | Clean Core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 

 

2. 关键用户扩展性

关键用户扩展性工具是SAP S/4HANA扩展性概念的主要支柱。它们是为云设计的，但也在本地/私有云版本中提供。

关键用户扩展性可用于：

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP S/4HANA（本地）和SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition及扩展版

2.1 获取概述

在我的博客中，我介绍了关键用户扩展性工具： 

  • The Key User Extensibility Tools of S/4 HANA
  • Extensibility - ABAP Platform
  • S/4HANA Extensibility: Use Case Overview
  • S/4HANA Extensibility Concept Details: Restricted ABAP
  • TechEd 2024: 🟢 What Software Developers Should Know About Key ... - SAP Community

如果您想了解关键用户拓展，我建议阅读我同事的博客 SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA – What is Key User Extensibility and Who are your Key Users and Introduction to S/4HANA Cloud and SAP S/4HANA On-Premise Key-User Extensibility . 

2.2 预告视频

放松一下，您可能会喜欢一些视频来获得扩展性外观和感觉的视觉印象：

  • Video: Journey of Managing Sales Orders in SAP Fiori: #4 Key User Adaptation
  • Video: Journey of Managing Sales Orders in SAP Fiori: #5 Extensibility and Custom Fields
  • Video: Extending Fixed Assets Master Data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Video: Creating Custom Fields
  • Video: Custom Business Objects (Creating Custom Applications, Implementing Business Logic)
  • Video: Creating Custom CDS Views as External APIs, Exposing Custom CDS Views as External APIs,  
  • Video: Creating Custom Analytical Queries

2.3 在教科书或培训中整合所有内容

Schneider, Thomas; Wolf, Werner: Erweiterungen für SAP S/4HANA（德语）SAP PRESS 2018（德语）。

2.4 文档

在开始开发之前，查看文档可能会有帮助（注：文档的语言和版本可在屏幕右上角选择）：

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的关键用户扩展性工具： https://help.sap.com/viewer/p/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD -> Product Assistance -> English -> Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud -> Extensibility -> Key User Extensibility
  • SAP S/4HANA（OP/PCE）中的关键用户扩展性工具：  https://help.sap.com/viewer/p/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE -> Product Assistance -> English -> Enterprise Technology -> ABAP Platform (or SAP Netweaver in older releases) -> Developing on the ABAP Platform -> Development Concepts and Tools -> Extensibility -> Key User Extensibility
  • 关键用户的UI适配工具：
    • Adapting SAP Fiori UIs at Runtime - Key User Adaptation - SAP Help Portal
    • Getting Started with UI Adaptations for Classic Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Fiori扩展性文档：扩展性 – SAP Library
  • 在Fiori应用库（Fiori Apps Library）中，您可以找到Fiori应用的扩展性信息。打开Fiori应用的应用详细信息，转到实施信息、扩展性部分。

2.5 动手实践：教程、最佳实践、操作指南

entry.title: How SAP’s ABAP Cloud Partner Reference App Simplifies Multi-Tenant Side-by-Side Extensions on BTP
entry.content:
The SAP BTP ABAP environment continues to unlock powerful opportunities for partners and developers seeking to extend and integrate with SAP Cloud ERP - particularly SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, by enabling SaaS extension development, leveraging existing ABAP expertise, and delivering benefits such as harmonized user experience, built-in product standard compliance, and simplified lifecycle management and operations out of the box. To further support this process, SAP offers the open-source ABAP Partner Reference Application as a best-practice resource.

The ABAP Partner Reference Application on SAP-Samples Git repository demonstrates how to design, build, and operate multi-tenant side-by-side applications using ABAP Cloud practices while following SAP’s recommended development approaches. The ABAP Partner Reference Application provides developers and technical architects with standard patterns, modular code, and documented guidance for building robust, multi-tenant ABAP applications on SAP BTP, fully integrated with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. It guides partners on designing, deploying, and extending ABAP solutions. It provides a blueprint for building scalable, multi-tenant apps that extend and integrate with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

 

What is the ABAP Partner Reference Application?

The ABAP Partner Reference Application (APRA) is a sample implementation that provides practical examples, such as the Music Festival Manager. It shows partners how to:

  • Build extensions on SAP BTP ABAP Cloud.
  • Integrate seamlessly with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Handle critical multi-tenant aspects such as tenant provisioning, onboarding, and isolation.
  • Follow SAP’s ABAP Cloud and Restful ABAP Programming Model (RAP) guidelines.

In short, it’s a real-world blueprint for partners who need a reference starting point.

Key Capabilities Highlighted

  • Multi-tenancy design: APRA showcases how to build applications that serve multiple tenants securely while keeping data isolated.
  • Tenant lifecycle management: Includes practical examples of provisioning and onboarding processes.
  • Integration patterns: Demonstrates how ABAP applications can consume SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition APIs side by side, extending core business logic without modification.
  • Best practices in ABAP Cloud: Clean-core extensions, RAP-based services, and modular design patterns are applied throughout

Why It Matters for Partners

For partners building SAP-certified solutions, alignment with ABAP Cloud principles is no longer optional. APRA offers more than just example code: it provides implementation guidance to ensure solutions are cloud-ready, scalable, and compliant. By studying and adapting the repository, partners save time, reduce uncertainty, and can fast-track their certification and deployment processes.

  • The repository demonstrates and aligns with SAP clean-core architecture and RAP best practices, enabling maintainable, upgrade-safe solutions. Along with modularization, helping partners build solutions that are scalable, maintainable, and compliant with SAP’s cloud-first best practices.
  • It provides real-world samples for rapid development of side-by-side extensions in the SAP BTP ABAP environment.
  • It demonstrates end-to-end flows: business object modelling, onboarding and provisioning, secure multi-tenancy, and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition API integration. It includes example business objects, tenant-specific onboarding logic, and detailed sample integrations with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition APIs, serving as ready-to-adapt templates for real-world enterprise scenarios.
  • Each step—from tenant lifecycle management to extending SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition functionality using side-by-side applications—is implemented with guidance notes and sample ABAP artifacts, making cloud development approachable for teams at any skill level.
  • Multi-Tenancy Patterns: Learn how to isolate data and processes by tenant, automate provisioning, and secure user access using SAP BTP role collections and dedicated onboarding flows.
  • Integration Points: Discover how to consume core APIs, events, and data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition while preserving ERP clean core, using recommended SAP BTP services for authentication, navigation, and extensibility.
  • RAP and ABAP Cloud Usage: Access sample RAP service definitions and back-end logic that illustrate SAP’s latest cloud-based application paradigms, making it straightforward to adopt modern development models.

 Getting Started / How to Use the Repository

The repository is publicly available on GitHub and welcomes exploration. Developers can:

  • Import the Music Festival Manager application from your abapGit repository into your ABAP environment in ADT, browse the artifacts, and review the README for instructions on deployment and configuration to start with ready-to-run examples or tutorials.
  • Follow the incremental development guides in the main branch to build up your own ABAP partner app using the same best practices. Follow examples for multi-tenant design, onboarding, and integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Analyze business object definitions, RAP service implementations, and onboarding/integration logic to adapt for your own solution. Use the sample reference application as templates for partner apps, adapting the RAP artifacts and onboarding logic for your business scenario and leverage the documented guidance to use APRA as a starting template for your own solutions.

Inside the Repository: Packages and Artifacts

  • The repository is organized to guide developers through building a core ABAP application, then evolving it into a multi-tenant solution.
  • Artifacts are grouped by application logic (business objects), onboarding flows, integration APIs, and service definitions that illustrate SAP’s recommended RAP approach.
  • The samples Music Festival Manager and Poetry Slam Manager demonstrate business object modeling, UI integration, and tenant isolation in real-world use cases.

 How the Repository Accelerates Partner Solutions

  • Partners can reuse packages, study onboarding approaches, and adapt integration modules directly for their own certified offerings—streamlining time to market and improving solution quality.
  • Step-by-step documentation, real code, and sample data flows empower developers to master multi-tenant patterns and extend SAP Cloud systems with confidence.
  • The repository acts as a knowledge base and starter kit for enterprise ABAP cloud projects, bridging theory and practical implementation for SAP’s partner ecosystem.

By exploring this repository, developers and architects gain hands-on experience with the foundations of multi-tenant architecture, SAP BTP-managed security, and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition integration—directly addressing the needs of modern cloud-native SAP applications.

For partners, the repository turns cloud-native theory into practice. Get hands on with SAP BTP ABAP Cloud, accelerate certified solution development, and leverage proven patterns for multi-tenant extensions—all with guided help from SAP’s own reference implementation.

entry.title: 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑限制供应商发票的多次暂存
entry.content:
问题背景：

有客户提出需求，希望限制已暂存过账后的采购订单对应的收货参考凭证以及参考凭证项目重复暂存。如果一个采购订单已经完成收货，参考凭证，并且完成了发票的过账，希望不能再对这个采购订单进行发票暂存。

解决方案：

尝试通过自定义逻辑，使用一个 BAdI 来满足需求。

分析步骤：

1. 以前帮助处理过客户的关于开票的需求，我们需要用到的业务增强点都是一样的。可以参见这两篇 Blog ：在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑检查预制发票的付款条件与供应商主数据中的付款条件是否一致 | SAP Blogs 以及 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑限制未完成收货的采购订单开票丨SAP Blogs。

首先，我们需要在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 系统的应用 – 自定义逻辑里，新增增强实施。根据业务场景，选择下图中的业务上下文以及业务加载项描述，填写好实施描述以及实施标识。

2. 在自定义逻辑里新增增强实施完成后，我们需要找到可以提供业务需求字段的 CDS Views 。经过测试，相同 PO + ITEM + 收货，如果已经过账，下次无法再选到这条收货凭证进行重复暂存。所以这里我采用作校验条件的字段是 PO 和 ITEM 号。同时，因为要校验这个 PO 和 ITEM 是否已经过账，所以要用到 I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01 里的 SUPPLIERINVOICESTATUS = '5' 。但是这个 CDS View 里没有 PO 和 ITEM 这两个字段，所以我们需要用到 I_SuplrInvcItemPurOrdRefAPI01 。在下面的示例代码里，我用到了一个自定义 CDS View ，您可以在自己的系统里基于 I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01 创建自定义 CDS View YY1_I_SUPPLIERINVOICEAPI01 ，选中对应字段，进行调整。

 

同时，正如我之前的文章里提到的，在 BAdI 给定的示例代码里，我们能发现有语句可以对触发 BAdI 的行为进行限制，根据我们的需要我们需要添加下面的语句限制 BAdI 仅在预制发票时触发，而不影响其他流程：

Park: if_ex_mrm_check_invoice_cloud=>c_Action_Park ”

3. 根据以上分析过程，实现 BAdI ，具体代码如下。

loop at ITEMSWITHPOREFERENCE REFERENCE INTO DATA(Supinvoice_item).
if action = if_ex_mrm_check_invoice_cloud=>c_Action_Hold.
    select single 
    from YY1_I_SUPPLIERINVOICEAPI01 with privileged access
    where PURCHASEORDER = @Supinvoice_item->PURCHASEORDER and PURCHASEORDERITEM = @Supinvoice_item->PURCHASEORDERITEM
    and SUPPLIERINVOICESTATUS = '5'
    into (Is_Supinvoice_status) .
    if Is_Supinvoice_status = abap_true.
      append value #( messagetype = 'E' messageid = 'MRM_BADI_CLOUD' messagenumber = '001' messagevariable1 = '暂存的发票有重复项目。' ) to messages.
    endif.
endif.
endloop.

4. 测试后，上述代码可以满足需求。

结语：

通过阅读本文以及之前写过的几篇相似场景的 Blog ，希望您已知晓在为采购订单预制发票时，如何通过自定义逻辑来进行一些限制。

您也可以通过后面的链接阅读更多有关 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 采购的博文：SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement - SAP Community

entry.title: 在 SAP S/4HANA Cloud 中通过自定义逻辑在101收货时将物料批次号自动设置为固定值
entry.content:
问题背景：

有客户提出需求，由于业务限制，希望在采购订单101收货时将批次号统一设置为物料号后八位，方便管理。

解决方案：

尝试通过自定义逻辑，使用一个 BAdI 来满足需求。

分析步骤：

1. 基于当前的业务描述，我们首先需要确认有哪些 BAdI 增强点支持当前需求。增强点 LOBM_AFTER_BATCH_NUMBER_INT ，根据文档描述，该增强点可以用于在内部批次号分配后创建一个新批次号并使用。但同时，这个 BAdI 的限制是对同一物料如果已经存在和新的批次号一样的批次号，则会返回错误。所以这个 BAdI 只能帮我们实现一部分需求，且我们需要添加逻辑防止重复创建。

2. 继续分析。增强点 MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA 可以用于在不同业务流程中修改收货单据的抬头、行项目数据，增强点 MMIM_ITEM_PROVIDE_DATA 可以用于更改不同流程的货物移动的文档项目字段中的数据。这两个增强点都可以满足我们的需求，但是前者只适用于 Post Goods Movement for Purchase Order 。所以我们配合后者，就可以满足在 MIGO 中的应用。

3. 我们现在已经找到了所有满足当前需求的增强点，现在，我们需要找到合适的 CDS Views ，提供所有我们需要的字段数据。CDS View I_Batch 存储了物料及相关的批次号，所以我们可以借助这个 CDS Views 来做条件判断。

4. 那接下来就是完成 BAdI 的逻辑。首先是利用 LOBM_AFTER_BATCH_NUMBER_INT 来解决需要创建批次号的情况。需要添加逻辑判断，只有在 I_Batch 里对应物料没有相同批次号的情况下才生效。

DATA: lv_new_batch TYPE I_batch-batch.
DATA: lv_batchnum TYPE string.
lv_new_batch = substring( val = batch_allocation-material
                                off = 10
                                len = 8 ).
IF batch_allocation-materialtype = 'ZROH'.
  SELECT SINGLE batch FROM i_batch WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS
  WHERE material = @batch_allocation-material AND batch = @LV_new_batch INTO @LV_batchnum.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      batch_out = lv_new_batch..
  ENDIF.
ENDIF.

5. 接下来是批次号对当前物料已经创建，我们只需要修改的情况。先实现 MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA 的逻辑。同样我们需要使用到 I_Batch 来做判断。

 DATA: lv_batch TYPE string,
       lv_material TYPE string, 
       lv_new_batch TYPE I_batch-batch,
       lv_batchnum TYPE string.
 LOOP AT gr4xy_item INTO DATA(ls_item).
  lv_new_batch = substring( val = ls_item-material
                               off = 10
                               len = 8 ).
  SELECT SINGLE batch FROM i_batch WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS
  WHERE material = @LS_item-material AND batch = @LV_new_batch INTO @LV_batchnum.
  IF sy-subrc = 0.
    lv_material = ls_item-material.
    IF ls_item-sourceofgr = 'PURORD'.
      lv_batch = substring( val = lv_material
      off = 10
      len = 8 ).
      LOOP AT change_item ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_change_item>).
        IF <fs_change_item>-deliverydocumentitem = ls_item-deliverydocumentitem.
          <fs_change_item>-batch = lv_batch.
          EXIT. 
        ENDIF.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
 ENDLOOP.

6. 最后就是 MMIM_ITEM_PROVIDE_DATA 的逻辑。实现后，我们就可以完成在 MIGO 里的逻辑。

DATA: lv_batch TYPE string,  " Define a variable to temporarily hold the batch.
      lv_new_batch TYPE I_batch-batch,
      lv_batchnum TYPE string.
IF invtrymgmtcallingappl EQ me->if_mmim_item_provide_data~gc_calling_application_migo."'MIGO'.    "for MIGO as calling appliction
  lv_new_batch = substring( val = item-material
                              off = 10
                              len = 8 ).
  SELECT SINGLE batch FROM i_batch WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS
  WHERE material = @item-material AND batch = @LV_new_batch INTO @LV_batchnum.
  IF sy-subrc = 0.
      change_item-batch = lv_new_batch.
  ENDIF.
ENDIF.

7. 测试后，上述代码可以满足需求。

entry.title: Enhanced Mapping of Advanced VariantConfiguration Characteristic Values to ProductionOrder Operation
entry.content:
Introduction

With the SAP Cloud ERP for Public Cloud 2502.4 release, a valuable new feature has been introduced, 'Enhanced Mapping of Advanced Variant Configuration Characteristic Values to Production Orders'. This enhancement allows you to map variant configuration characteristic values directly to custom fields within production routing operations. These custom fields can then be used as parameters in Work Centre formulas to dynamically calculate activities such as machine processing time, labour, and setup costs.

In this blog post, we'll explore how this feature can be applied in a real-world scenario to improve cost accuracy and operational efficiency in a manufacturing process.

Business Scenario

Imagine an automobile manufacturing company where the sit fitment time and cost vary depending on the number of seats to be installed in a custom-built caravan. In the custom-built caravan production process, the sit fitment time is calculated based on the number of seats selected by the customer during order configuration. In this case, the sit fitment time is expressed as machine time, calculated using a custom formula in the Work Centre.

Let’s say the time factor is 1 for assembling 5 seats, which serves as the base configuration. We then maintain time factors of 3 for 6 seats and 5 for 7 seats to represent the proportionally higher effort and machine time required as the seat count increases, due to added installation work, alignment, and quality checks.

The table below illustrates this:

Seat Count (Z_SEAT_COUNT)

Time Factor (Z_SAFT)

Explanation

5

1

Base time unit

6

3

3× time of 5-seat fitment

7

5

5× time of 5-seat fitment

Consider the characteristic Z_SEAT_COUNT captures the number of seats selected. The system uses a dependency procedure (e.g., SEAT_ASSEMBLY) to calculate the machine time factor (Z_SAFT), which is then used to determine the overall operation time in routing.

This feature is especially valuable for industries that manufacture products with dynamic or customizable designs—such as automotive, furniture, modular kitchens, pool tile manufacturing, or industrial machinery—where production time and cost vary significantly based on configuration-specific attributes.

In the following section, we’ll walk through how this use case can be implemented using the new feature in SAP Cloud ERP for Public Cloud.

Prerequisites

Before implementing this feature, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  1. Activate the Feature
    Enable the feature "Map Object Dependency Value to Operation" (FTGL_PPH_MD_MAPOBJDPNVALS_2) via the Activate Features configuration activity in your system.

  1. Create a Custom Field
    Define a custom field under the business context Manufacturing: Bill of Operations Operation. This field will be used in the Work Centre formula to calculate activities like machine, setup or labour time and cost.
    For detailed steps on how to create a custom field and incorporate it into a Work Centre formula, refer to the link below:
    👉https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/step-by-step-guide-to-setting-up-custom-fields-in-work-center-formula/ba-p/14123514
  2. Create a Super Routing with Object Dependency
    Set up a Super Routing for the configurable material and assign an Object Dependency of type 'Procedure' to the relevant operation.
    For guidance on how to create a routing for configurable materials, refer to the documentation below:
    👉https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/f369b2eff700401494ba6e7c9a573288/d5ed07180f7a40189b043c8156157919.html?version=2502.500

Step-by-Step Execution:

1) Create and Verify Custom Field
Ensure that a custom field is created in the business context Manufacturing: Bill of Operations Operation. This field should be visible at the operation level in the routing.
In this example, we’ve created a custom field called Seat Assembly Time Factor (YY1_SEAT_ASSEMBLY_TIME_PPO) to represent the offset value used for time and cost calculation.

2) Define Work Centre Formula
Create a Work Centre formula (e.g., Z_TIME) that uses a parameter (e.g., Z_SATF) linked to the custom field created above. This formula will be used to dynamically calculate activity times based on the selected configuration

3) Assign Formula to Work Centre Activities
Assign the custom formula (Z_TIME) to the relevant activity types (e.g., Setup, Machine, or Labour) in the Work Centre (SEATASMB) responsible for the seat assembly operation.    

4) Create Characteristic and Map to Custom Field
Define a variant configuration characteristic (e.g., Z_SATF) and map it to the custom field YY1_SEAT_ASSEMBLY_TIME_PPO. This enables the system to pass characteristic values to the routing operation dynamically.

5) Create Super Routing and Assign Procedure
Set up a Super Routing for the configurable material (e.g., a car model), and assign an Object Dependency of type ‘Procedure’ to the relevant operation (e.g., Seat Assembly).
In this example, the Seat Assembly Time Factor (Z_SATF) is determined based on the selected number of seats. The procedure is defined as below,

WorkCentre SEATASMB assigned to the operation 0025 – Assemble Seat Units

Object dependency of type Procedure

Dependency Editor

6) Create Sales Order and Test Configuration
Once all the above steps are complete, create a Sales Order for the configurable material. On the Variant Configuration screen, select the desired number of seats.
Then, review the machine cost and overall calculated activity costs — they should adjust dynamically based on the selected characteristic value (i.e., the number of seats).

a) Select number of seats as ‘5’ in the variant configuration screen

Cost of Goods Sold and Seat assembly machine processing cost for 5-seater.

b) Select number of seats as ‘6’ in the variant configuration screen

Cost of Goods Sold and Seat assembly machine processing cost for 6-seater.

c) Select number of seats as ‘7’ in the variant configuration screen

Cost of Goods Sold and Seat assembly machine processing cost for 5-seater.

Conclusion

The “Enhanced Mapping of Advanced Variant Configuration Characteristic Values to Production Orders” feature in SAP Cloud ERP for Public Cloud 2502.4 offers greater flexibility and accuracy in manufacturing configurable materials. By mapping configuration characteristics to custom fields in production operations and using them in Work Centre formulas, manufacturers can calculate activity times and costs dynamically based on real-time inputs. In the seat assembly example, processing time and cost adjust based on the number of seats selected, improving cost transparency and operational efficiency. This is especially valuable in make-to-order and engineer-to-order scenarios, where production effort varies with each configuration.

By leveraging it, businesses can better align operational planning with customer-specific configurations—driving both efficiency and customer satisfaction.

Happy Learning!!

entry.title: Custom Business Configurations (F4579): Controlling the visibility of BC Objects using authorization
entry.content:
Introduction

The Custom Business Configurations (CUBCO) app serves as an entry point to the Business Configuration Maintenance Object provided by custom applications or partners.
Depending on the respective role the user should only be able to edit certain business configurations.

This blog is relevant for

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition  
  • SAP BTP ABAP environment  

Further reading:

  • Related blog posts
  • Learn how you can use ABAP technology to develop innovative applications and business solutions across SAP’s portfolio on SAP Learning Site.

Basic Concept

An OData V4 service is assigned to each business configuration object (SMBC). The corresponding service binding is based on a RAP BO.
The list of available business configuration objects in the CUBCO app is restricted to those where the user has the start authorization for the service binding (authorization object S_START,  see access control object I_SMBC_CONFIGURATION_TP).  The application-specific authorizations are not checked until an SMBC object has been selected. That is, authorization control implemented in the RAP BO. Normally, the authorization object S_TABU_NAM is used, but you can also use any other authorization object.

Therefore, you can create business roles in which only a subset of all business configuration objects can be used.

SAP BTP ABAP environment, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

IAM apps are the smallest building block for creating business roles. For a business configuration object, you assign the OData service binding and the application relevant authorization objects to it. You then create a business catalog to collect IAM apps and finally assign business catalogs to business roles.

Example:
You have four SMBC objects A, B, C, D in the system and a different OData service binding for each SMBC object. The authorization object S_TABU_NAM is used in all RAP BOs. You create four IAM apps A, B, C, D, each containing the OData service of a different SMBC object and the authorization object S_TABU_NAM. You create a business catalog BC1 that contains the IAM apps A, B, and a business catalog BC2 that contains the IAM apps B, C, D.

You assign a business role containing the business catalog BC1 to a user. This user can work with the SMBC objects A, B. The user cannot see or edit the SMBC objects C and D.
You assign a business role containing the business catalog BC2 to a user. This user can work with the SMBC objects B, C, D. The user cannot see or work with the SMBC object A.

SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition

IAM apps are not available. You add the application relevant authorization objects to the authorization default of the OData service assigned to the SMBC object. In the PFCG role you then add the authorization default.

Example:
You have four SMBC objects A, B, C, D in the system and a different OData service binding for each SMBC object. You assign a PFCG role containing the authorization default for the OData services of SMBC objects A, B to a user. This user can work with the SMBC objects A, B. The user cannot see or edit the SMBC objects C and D.

Note that roles that contain the Custom Business Configurations Fiori app do not automatically derive the required authorization for the SMBC objects. You need to add the authorization default of the OData service manually.

entry.title: BigCommerce seamless integration with SAP Cloud ERP - Complete Setup & Demo Guide
entry.content:
Tired of Juggling Data Between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce? We’ve Got You Covered!

Managing data and business processes across SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition) and BigCommerce can often be a challenging and time-consuming task — especially when done manually or through custom-built integrations. That’s why we’re excited to introduce a ready-to-use integration package powered by SAP Integration Suite, built to simplify and streamline your operations.

Designed specifically for B2C commerce scenarios, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures:

  • Seamless data synchronization between SAP and BigCommerce
  • Automated workflows for key business processes
  • A reduction in manual tasks and potential errors

In this blog, we’ll start with a high-level overview of what the integration offers. Then, we’ll walk you through a step-by-step guide to setting up the package — so you can get your systems connected and running efficiently with minimal effort.

Note : SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package accelerator isn’t just limited to B2C. Partners can extend the integration to support B2B use cases as well, tailoring it to fit the needs of more complex business models. The package is built with extensibility in mind, so partners can enhance it further to accommodate specific business requirements or tailor it to specific industry needs. Partner can enhace the Integration Flows for bidirectional synchronization between BigCommerce & SAP Cloud ERP for the following entities:

  • Products, Price, Discounts & Tax
  • Product Variants ( Recommend customer project to leverage separate Products )
  • B2B Customer Master Data & Payment Settlement Flows
  • Enhance the use-case to cover Promotions and Classification

 

Overview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Integration Package:

SAP provides a variety of pre-built integration accelerators via the SAP Integration Suite, all accessible through the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Among these, we’ve developed a dedicated BigCommerce integration accelerator that enables a seamless connection between your BigCommerce storefront and SAP Cloud ERP and its available with SAP Cloud Integration Suite Starter Edition and Standard Edition.

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package ensures real-time data consistency across both platforms by synchronizing key business objects such as:

  •  🛒  Product information
  •  📦  Inventory levels/Product Stock
  • 💲Product Prices & Discounts 
  •  👤  Customer information

By automating critical business processes like order creation, cancellations, and returns, the integration reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and increases operational efficiency. It also synchronizes shipping and delivery details, helping you provide accurate and timely updates to customers — a key to delivering a superior B2C customer experience.

The BigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud package is designed to integrate key end-to-end business processes between SAP Cloud ERP and BigCommerce, enabling smooth, automated data flow and operational consistency across both platforms.

The following core business processes are supported out of the box:

📦 From SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce:

  • ✅ Replicate Products – Ensure accurate and up-to-date product information is reflected in your BigCommerce storefront.
  • 📊 Replicate Product Stock – Keep inventory levels in sync to avoid overselling or stockouts.
  • 💲 Replicate Product Prices & Discounts – Automatically update pricing and promotional details in BigCommerce.
  • 🚚 Replicate Delivery Details – Provide timely and accurate shipping information to your customers via BigCommerce.

🛒From BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP:

  • 👥 Replicate B2C Customers – Capture and transfer customer data from BigCommerce to SAP, enabling centralized customer management.
  • 🧾Replicate Orders – Seamlessly transfer incoming sales orders into SAP for fulfillment and processing.
  • ❌ Replicate Order Cancellations – Reflect cancelled orders in SAP for proper stock and financial reconciliation.
  • 🔁 Replicate Order Returns – Automatically push return details from BigCommerce into SAP to streamline reverse logistics.

Together, these integration flows deliver a robust, automated B2C commerce experience, reducing manual interventions and ensuring your front-end and back-end systems remain in sync.

🚀 How to Set Up the “BigCommerce Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition” Package

Integrating BigCommerce with SAP Cloud ERP is now easier than ever — thanks to the pre-built accelerator available on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. This step-by-step guide will help you configure and deploy the integration package using SAP Integration Suite, so your systems can work together seamlessly.

✅Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

  • 🔑  An SAP Partner Account with access to SAP Integration Suite (via SAP BTP – Business Technology Platform).
  • 🧾 Access to SAP Cloud ERP.
  • 🛍  A BigCommerce Partner or Merchant Account.SAP Cloud ERP
  • 📘  Basic knowledge of SAP BTP, Integration Suite and BigCommerce . 
  • 🌐  Access to SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • 📘Detailed Configure Guide - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  • Refer to BigCommerce Receiver Adapter | SAP Help Portal

 🛠️  Step 1: Set Up SAP Integration Suite instance using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) account.

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  2. Create a Subaccount and enable Integration Suite:
    • Navigate to your Global Account > Subaccount.
    • Create or open an Integration Suite instance.
    • Assign relevant entitlements and Assign relevant roles
    • Use the Booster Enable Integration Suite to automate setup or configure manually
    • for more details refer to sap help documentation SAP Integration Suite | SAP Help Portal

📦 Step 2: Import the BigCommerce Adapter Package into SAP Integration Suite

  1. Goto SAP Integration Suite instance
  2. Go to Discover tab.
  3. Search for “BigCommerce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite”.
  • Click “Copy” to add / move the package to your Design workspace.

  • To Configure BigCommerce Adapter Installation - Installing the BigCommerce Adapter is a prerequisite to use the Integration Content. For adapter installation, refer to the “BigCommerce Adapter Guide” and also refer to section Configure Adapter in Communication Channels and documents section in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

🔄Step 3: Configure BigCommerce iFlows (Integration Flows) with API access relevant details.

  1. Go to Design > Integrations in the Integration Suite.
  2. Open the imported BigCommerce Integration Package.
  3. Select a relevant iFlow (e.g., Replicate Orders from BigCommerce to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition).
  4. Configure the necessary Externalized Parameters and Connections, referencing the detailed documentation for each Integration Flow.
  5. To Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP - the mandatory configurations which need to be performed in the SAP Cloud ERP before you can start implementing the configuration for BigCommerce API and configuring the Integration Content in SAP Integration Suite and for more details refer to section "Configuration in SAP Cloud ERP" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  6. Sample configuration shown below.

      BigCommerce Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • BigCommerce Base Url: https://<yourshop>.myBigCommerce.com/
  • BigCommerce Secure Parameter: The name of the BigCommerce access token secure parameter 

       SAP Cloud ERP Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Base Url: https://<your-sap-s4-hana-instance-id>-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
  • Credential Name: The name of the SAP Cloud ERP secure parameter 

🧩 Example Integration Flows:

  • BigCommerce ➜ SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition : Customer Replication, New Orders, Order Cancellations & Returns
  • SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition ➜ BigCommerce : Products, Inventory Synchronization, Stock Availability, Delivery Status

🚀Step 4: Deploy and Test the Integration Package in Integration Suite

  1. Deploy selected iFlows from your Design workspace.
  2. Monitor from Monitor > Integrations > Message Processing Logs.
  3. Perform test transactions: for more details refer to Demo section in the blog
    • Place a test order in BigCommerce.
    • Monitor the message logs and confirm data replication in SAP Cloud ERP: Sales Orders, Business Partners, Product Catalog

🔧 Extend or Customize the Package (Optional)

As a partner you can extend or tailor the integration through:

  • Customer Exits to plug-in your custom integration flows (Pre Exits and Post Exits in Intergration Flows)
  • Copy and modify the integration content.
  • Groovy scripts to customize payload mappings.
  • Content Modifiers to apply business logic.
  • Enhanced error handling and alerting.

 💡 Partner Tips & Monetization Opportunities

As an SAP Partner, you can:

  • 💡 Extend the integration flows and Build new integration flows using SAP BigCommerce adapter
  • 📜  Demo your solution with real-time order sync and inventory updates, build a demo to show real-time sync between BigCommerce and SAP with custom business case.
  • 🧰 Buildc Multi-Tenant Integration Templates for reuse across customers.
  • 🧠 Leverage SAP Integration Advisor for intelligent mapping.
  • 💡  Add your branding, services, or vertical-specific enhancements.

  • Step 1 : View the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with BigCommerce integration package in Integration Suite
  • Step 2: Show product in SAP Cloud ERP  (to be replicated to BigCommerce)
  • Step 3: Start replication of product in integration suite
  • Step 4: Show replicated product in BigCommerce and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product
  • Step 5: Log into BigCommerce as customer and browse through existing products
  • Step 6: Select the product replicated from SAP Cloud ERP and add to basket
  • Step 7: Enter the relevant details like payment and create order
  • Step 8: Check the order created in BigCommerce
  • Step 9: Replicate the order from BigCommerce to SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 10: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as internal_sales_rep and look for “Manage Sales Order Version 2” app and open the sales order and change the order date to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Step 11: Log into SAP Cloud ERP as shipping_specialist and open app “Create outbound delivery with order reference”
  • Step 12: Enter shipping point and enter the sales order and shipping date as todays date and save , note down the Outbound Delivery ID
  • Step 13: Open app “pick outbound delivery” and enter Outbound Delivery ID and enter Actual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter picking quantity as 1 and save
  • Step 14 : Click on Post GI and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to Completely Processed. Note : show the SO Process flow of created order in SAP Cloud ERP
  • Step 15 : Replicate the Outbound delivery from SAP Cloud ERP to BigCommerce.
  • Step 16: Open sales order in BigCommerce and show the OD created in SAP Cloud ERP reflected in metadata fields of Sales order and status of Sales Order is changed to fulfilled.

Detailed Demo steps:

Step 2: Access to SAP Cloud ERP System to show the replicating product master

entry.title: Entendiendo la Extensibilidad en SAP Cloud ERP: Parte 1
entry.content:
En el mundo de los sistemas de gestión empresarial, extender una aplicación o funcionalidad estándar es crucial para adaptarse a aquellas necesidades específicas de tu negocio o para darle competitividad a tu negocio con diferenciación. SAP Cloud ERP o comúnmente llamada SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, ofrece una amplia gama de opciones que le permiten a las empresas personalizar sus sistemas sin comprometer la actualización automática (upgrade) de la plataforma. En este blog y en español 🙂,  exploraremos los tipos de extensiones disponibles en SAP Cloud ERP y cómo saber cúal y cuando usarlas. Este blog es la primera parte de una serie que pretende explicar de forma sencilla las opciones para extender SAP Cloud ERP.

 

In-App Extensions

¿Qué son? Las In-App Extensions permiten personalizar aplicaciones directamente dentro del entorno de SAP Cloud ERP.  Estas extensiones son ideales para pequeños ajustes y personalizaciones que no requieren un desarrollo complejo.

Para el desarrollo de extensiones In-App tenemos dos opciones:

  • Key-user Extensibility: Estas extensiones son fáciles de crear, no requieren conocimiento complejo de programación y se hacen directamente en el sistema. Puedes crear campos personalizados, extensiones de fuentes de datos e implementar descripciones para contextos empresariales específicos, adaptando así las aplicaciones predefinidas a las necesidades de tu negocio. También puedes crear vistas personalizadas de CDS (SAP Core Data Services) basadas en fuentes de datos predefinidas, combinar datos de diferentes fuentes y reorganizar los campos de las tablas según las necesidades específicas de la aplicación.
  • Developer Extensibility: Este tipo de extensiones se crean utilizando las ADT (ABAP Development Tools), requieren de conocimiento de ABAP y actualmente premiten el uso de ABAP Cloud. La extensibilidad del desarrollador permite crear proyectos de desarrollo en SAP Cloud ERP, incluyendo la creación de servicios y aplicaciones SAP Fiori personalizados con el modelo ABAP RESTful Application Programming (RAP), utilizando un subconjunto optimizado para la nube del lenguaje ABAP y APIs/objetos liberados de SAP, con acceso controlado a herramientas administrativas y con seguridad predeterminada para tablas personalizadas.

¿Cuándo usarlas?

  • Key User Extensibility: Ideal para usuarios finales que necesitan realizar ajustes menores y personalizaciones básicas sin necesidad de codificación extensiva.
  • Developer Extensibility: Necesaria para desarrolladores que requieren crear funcionalidades completamente nuevas, realizar integraciones complejas o realizar optimizaciones avanzadas, conocimiento de ABAP es necesario

Ventajas:

  • Integración: Totalmente integradas dentro del sistema, lo que asegura una actualización sin problemas.
  • Rapidez: Permiten realizar cambios rápidamente sin necesidad de salir del entorno de SAP S/4HANA.

 

Side-by-Side Extensions

¿Qué son? Las Side-by-Side Extensions se desarrollan fuera del entorno de SAP Cloud ERP utilizando el SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), pero se integran con el sistema mediante APIs liberados. Estas extensiones son ideales para necesidades más complejas que no pueden ser cubiertas por las extenciones directamente en la solucion (Key-user y Developer Extensibility).

¿Cuándo usarlas?

  • Desarrollar aplicaciones personalizadas que complementen la funcionalidad estándar de SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Integrar con sistemas de terceros o soluciones externas.
  • Crear portales de clientes o aplicaciones móviles.
  • Aprovechar las capacidades de SAP Build
  • Desarrollar extensiones usando múltiples lenguajes de programación como ABAP, Java, JavaScript o Python.

Ventajas:

  • Flexibilidad: Permiten un mayor grado de personalización y complejidad.
  • Independencia: El desarrollo se realiza fuera del sistema, lo que facilita la gestión del ciclo de vida de la aplicación y mantenimiento.
  • Integración: Utilizan APIs estándar para conectarse con SAP Cloud ERP, lo que asegura una integración segura y eficiente.

 

Conclusión

Las opciones para extender SAP Cloud ERP, son diversas, permiten adaptar la solución a las necesidades específicas de cada negocio, principalmente teniendo como ventaja, que no comprometen la estabilidad ni la capacidad de actualización del sistema. Desde In-App Extensions para cambios rápidos y sencillos, hasta Side-by-Side Extensions para necesidades más complejas y Custom Apps para soluciones altamente personalizadas, cada tipo de extensión tiene su propósito y ventajas.

Espero que esta guía te haya proporcionado una comprensión clara de las opciones de extensibilidad disponibles en SAP Cloud ERP.

¡No dudes en explorar más para descubrir cómo estas herramientas pueden ayudar a tu empresa a alcanzar nuevos niveles de eficiencia y personalización!

Introduction:

This guide shows how to enforce a validation in S/4HANA Public Cloud so that only the project manager of a project can change its WBS elements. We will combine Custom CDS Views to derive the project manager and the Enterprise Project Cloud BAdI to implement the validation at runtime.

Standard behaviour:

In the standard Project Control – Enterprise Projects app (F3215), any user with the role SAP_BR_PROJ_FIN_CONTROLLER or assigned the roles like Project FIN Controller or project manager can modify projects and project elements; there is no built-in check to restrict changes to only assigned roles like project manager.

SAP provides several released CDS views for enterprise projects, such as:

  • I_EnterpriseProject
  • I_EnterpriseProjectTeamMember
  • I_EntProjectEntitlement
  • I_EnterpriseProjectRole

However, none of these exposes the project manager directly, so we will build a custom CDS view to identify who the project manager is per project.

Prerequisites:

You need the following business roles to develop and test this solution:

 Business Role

Business Role ID

Extensibility Specialist

SAP_BR_EXTENSIBILITY_SPEC

Project Financial Controller

SAP_BR_PROJ_FIN_CONTROLLER

 

If you do not have these roles, ask your administrator to assign them, or, if you are the administrator, follow the  Maintain Business Users guide.

For debugging Cloud BAdIs, you may also need:

Business Role

Business Role ID

Application Support Engineer - Development Support

SAP_BR_APPL_SUP_ENG_DEV_SUP

Application Support Engineer

SAP_BR_APPL_SUPPORT_ENGINEER

For general background on BAdI debugging, see the blog  Generate Customer Project Id via BAdI Project Determination (/S4PPM/PROJECT_DETERMINATION_2).

Development Overview:

  1. Create a custom CDS view that joins project entitlements with team members and roles to expose the project manager.
  2. Create a project manager view that resolves the business user.
  3. Implement the Enterprise Project validation BAdI to block changes to WBS elements by non–project managers.

Step 1 Create Custom CDS view that joins project entitlements with team members and roles

Open the APP: Custom CDS Views (Fiori ID: F1866A)

  • Name: YY1_ProjectTeamEntitlement
  • Scenario: Standard CDS view

Add Associated Data Source:  I_EnterpriseProjectTeamMember, I_EnterpriseProjectRole, I_EnterpriseProject.

 

The overview data source is as follows: 

Notes:

- I_EntProjectEntitlement is required; without it, the link between the team member and the role will be missing.

- When joining I_EntProjectEntitlement and I_EnterpriseProjectTeamMember, include both ProjectUUID and TeamMemberUUID in the join.

- Include Role Category to filter for the project manager for the next step.

- Include BusinessPartnerUUID to retrieve project manager details.

 

 

Step2: Create the Project Manager view:

  • Name: YY1_ProjectManager
  • Scenario: Standard CDS view
  • Primary Data Source: YY1_ProjectTeamEntitlement

Add Associated Data Source:  I_BusinessUserBasic.

Define filters so that only project managers are returned:

 

You can preview the data to verify that the correct project manager information is exposed per project:

Step3: Implement Enterprise Project Validation BADI

Open APP: Custom Logic (Fiori ID: F6957)

Create Custom Logic implementation with:

  • Business Context: Project Element
  • Select ID: /S4PPM/PROJ_ELMNT_VALIDATION

 

* Example code for Project Manager validation

  DATA(current_user) = cl_abap_context_info=>get_user_technical_name( ).

  SELECT SINGLE * FROM YY1_ProjectManager WITH PRIVILEGED ACCESS

     WHERE projectuuid = @enterpriseprojectelement-projectuuid

*       AND userID = @Current_User

      INTO @DATA(l_ProjectManager).

  IF l_ProjectManager-userId <> current_user.

      APPEND INITIAL LINE TO validationmessages ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_validationmessage>).

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessageclass     = '/S4PPM/VAL_DET'.

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessagetype    = 'E'.

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessagenumber  = '000'.

      <ls_validationmessage>-systemmessagevariable1 = 'WBS can only changed by Project Manager'.
