This logic fetches the current technical user, looks up the project’s manager from YY1_ProjectManager, and raises an error if the current user is not the project manager.

Now test by editing a WBS under a project managed by another user; the system raises an error:

 

 

Conclusion

This walkthrough demonstrates how to restrict WBS element changes to the assigned project manager in S/4HANA Public Cloud. By deriving the project manager through custom CDS views and enforcing the rule via the Enterprise Project validation BAdI, you can add a targeted control that is not available in standard functionality.

entry.title: Taking Control of Clean Core: When to Use Project Kernseife in addition to Standard SAP Tools
entry.content:
TL;DR

Measuring SAP Clean Core involves a choice:

  • As a RISE with SAP customer, you can benefit from the out-of-the-box standard approach with SAP Cloud ALM. The RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard provides you with a high-level standardized view with minimal effort.
  • Or you can choose an open-source, highly flexible, and customizable approach with Project Kernseife. You get custom classification to create actionable insights, but it requires ownership and additional effort.

This article will help you decide which path is right for your team's Clean Core journey.

How the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard measures Clean Core

SAP's answer on how to measure clean core is based on two standard tools: The ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) (and its newly released checks as from SAP Note 3565942) and the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard in SAP Cloud ALM.

The process begins with the ATC, which analyzes your custom code against a well-defined set of rules. The key to this analysis is the classification of your custom extensions based on the official release status of the standard SAP objects they utilize. This release information is transparently published by SAP in the Cloudification Repository (Viewer).

As described in more detail in the Clean Core Extensibility Whitepaper (see chapter 3.3), the ATC assigns your extension a level based on the most critical SAP object it utilizes:

  • Level A - For extensions using only stable, released objects, ensuring maximum upgrade security.
  • Level B - For extensions whose most critical dependency is a classic API like a BAPI or classic technical frameworks.
  • Level C - For extensions touching any unreleased, internal SAP objects.
  • Level D - For extensions using objects that are explicitly not recommended.

The results of this structured analysis can then be uploaded to SAP Cloud ALM, populating the Clean Core Extensibility KPIs in the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard. Recently, the dashboard was enhanced with a display of the Clean Core  Levels. This gives organizations a high-level, standardized view of their extensibility landscape, which is perfect for assessing their current situation and tracking progress. For the near future (Q1/2026) it is moreover planned to offer a deep dive dashboard that provides further details about the results.

What is "Project Kernseife"?

Project Kernseife is an open-source custom ATC Check for ABAP systems that enables you to flexibly score the usage of SAP objects in your system, e.g. to score the technical debt regarding clean core based on a custom, adjustable classification. More details on the parts and approach can be found in the blog "Project Kernseife - improving the measurement of Clean Core in ABAP".

Why Project Kernseife and its custom classification can be a Game-Changer for Clean Core Governance

Advantage 1: Fine-Tune SAP's Rules & Reduce "False Positives"

While SAP delivers thousands of released and classic APIs, it might still be not the perfect fit for your individual project and scope. Kernseife allows you to customly classify objects as "acceptable for your project", dramatically reducing noise and the need for mass ATC exemptions. Let's look into two different scenarios, to show you the benefits of custom classification:

Example 1: Stricter governance for direct table read

Within the standard classification, a direct read with a SELECT from any SAP table is considered as "Level C", which leads to warnings in ABAP Test Cockpit. In your project, you want to enforce the usage of ABAP cloud, you maybe have (see next point) identified many successor objects (custom and standard) and want to push developers to the successors objects (e.g., famous I_Product instead of MARA) by showing these as an error.
Remark: In standard ATC, you can adjust the priority of a check message in general (for example "Reading from DDIC database tables or DDIC table views is not recommended (successor available)", but not based on specific SAP objects you refer to.

Example 2: Need for usage of "internal object"

Now let's imagine you are working in a "clean core" project, but you need to extend processes around the Outbound Delivery Orders in EWM. After talking to experts, finding blog posts and even an "official" SAP Note, you identified the right interface: /SCWM/IF_API_WHR_OUTBOUND. Unfortunately, this is not yet listed as released or classic API. This would result in "warnings" in ATC and a classification as Level C ("Internal Objects" are used), although you did the best you can do. With Kernseife, you can now mark this SAP object as "recommended", which results in only "information" messages in ATC and leads to a "Level B" assessment of the custom code object / extension.

Based on these two examples, you can see: this is the power of a custom classification. You can overrule the SAP standard, be it because of timing (as you need the announced adjustments from the blog IMMEDIATELY) or scope (because SAP might not generally classify everything that you identify as "acceptable for your project" as "Classic API").

The possibility to "accept" usage of certain SAP objects will increase your governance quality, as your exemption approvers will not be flooded with hundreds of "false" exemption requests for objects that you generally accept in your project.

Advantage 2: Define and Enforce Custom Successors

While SAP is already delivering hundreds of the most important successor classifications (famous MARA -> I_Product), there might still be potential to guide your developers more precisely. Project Kernseife allows you to maintain a successor object in your classification, that will also be visible in the result of your ATC check - this makes it actionable for your developer!

 

Example 1: "Improve" Standard Successors

There are some more tables in the system, that have no successor mentioned officially, but where you can find (released!) CDS views as an alternative. To not flood you with details here, I simply refer to another blog based on the idea of @AndreasGraeber. But also for Function Modules or classes , there might be clear successors (e.g. not all READ_<table> might be having the successor information. There might be a lot of areas, where you want to decide in your project "don't use this, but use that!"

Example 2: Enforce and centralize Wrappers / custom successors

What happens if you create a wrapper for a standard SAP object, but your colleagues are not aware of it? They might re-create the same wrapper. With the possibility to also add Custom Objects (e.g. Z_WRAPPER_ABC) as a successor, you can also push your developers to harmonize the usage of wrappers.

Advantage 3: Enhance Dashboards for Measurement and Governance with consistent transparency

In several projects, we have already seen custom dashboards to track the current state of clean core. With the combination of the level concept and the "Technical Debt Score", you can assess systems and drill down into packages or even single objects.

Project Kernseife offers you direct access (e.g. with CDS-View ZKNSF_I_SCORING) to the data from ATC check runs to build these dashboards. You can use the Kernseife BTP Application to analyze your score - or create your own dashboard, for example with SAP Analytics Cloud, reflecting your custom rules to assign custom objects to business units (e.g. ZBR* is always Brasil).

The scoring is based on your configuration in the Kernseife classification, which allows you to own the definition of your clean core levels and deviate from SAP's standard definition - by this you own the definition of your clean core levels! To stick with the examples above, the usage of /SCWM/IF_API_WHR_OUTBOUND will impact your score in a limited way.

Advantage 4: Prioritize Your Cleanup Efforts with a "Potential Score"

After an analysis, you often face a daunting list of findings. The biggest challenge isn’t just identifying the issues, but knowing where to start the cleanup. This is where Kernseife's scoring mechanism becomes a powerful prioritization engine by providing two key metrics for each finding: a Score and a Potential Score.

  • The Score reflects the technical debt of the object as it exists today, based on your custom rules.
  • The Potential Score shows what the score would be if the developer refactored the code to use the defined successor.

Let's use our familiar example:

  • Your classification assigns a high "Technical Debt" Score of 10 for a direct SELECT on table MARA.
  • The officially released successor, I_Product, has a "clean" score of 0. Therefore, the finding's Potential Score is 0.

This creates a clear, quantifiable "improvement gap." An object with a Score of 10 and a Potential Score of 0 is a high-impact cleanup opportunity. In contrast, a finding with a Score of 2 and no defined successor (meaning its Potential Score is also 2) is a lower priority for immediate refactoring.

By sorting your findings based on the largest gap between the Score and Potential Score, you can instantly identify the "low-hanging fruits" and the refactoring tasks with the biggest impact. Let's be clear, this is just one piece of information, and maybe you shouldn't have any custom code in this area based on a process analysis, but I still believe it is important to have data to drive your decisions - and Project Kernseife offers you data for the technical insights.

Making the Right Choice: A Balanced Look at Both Approaches

Key Reasons to Adopt Project Kernseife

The main reason to use a Project Kernseife is typically the power of the custom classification (as the last chapter pointed out). You can adjust the classification of SAP objects based on your project reality and support your clean core journey with tailored data.

In addition, there might be a temporary, tactical benefit: As of today, Kernseife's dashboards can fill a gap until SAP's "Extensibility Deep Dive" dashboard is generally available. 

Important Considerations: When the Standard Approach is a Better Fit

At the same time, I want to be very clear: Project Kernseife is not needed in every company and project.

  • 1. The Need for Standard Alignment: If your primary goal is to align perfectly with SAP's out-of-the-box reporting and dashboards without deviation, the standard approach is more appropriate.
  • 2. The Responsibility of Power: Custom classification is powerful, but it requires ownership. Someone must define, document, and maintain these custom rules. This is an ongoing responsibility (and effort!), which you can spare yourself when you go with the standard solution, i.e. RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard.
  • 3. Implementation and Maintenance Overhead: While straightforward for experienced teams, implementing and maintaining any non-standard solution requires effort that must be planned for. It is ironically against the clean core imperative of leveraging "standard"!
  • 4. Unified Classification enables comparibility: Standardized classification leads to a comparability between different systems (e.g., you compare your central finance system with a peer system regarding the clean core level share), as the classification is the same for all systems.

Conclusion: Do you need to Take Control of Your Clean Core Strategy?

Project Kernseife is not for everyone. It is for organizations that find the standard clean core measurement too rigid and are ready to invest the effort to build a more nuanced, context-aware governance model. If you have the capacity and the architectural vision, it can transform your clean core initiative from a technical cleanup exercise into a strategic management of your system's extensibility.

Interested in more? Check out Project Kernseife: our open-source project where you can join the community, contribute, and support us with a GitHub star in the repository!

entry.title: Cloud BAdI to Influence Sales Document Copy Control
entry.content:
Cloud BAdIs For Sales Document Copy Control

As I explained in blog Sales Document BAdI Overview, there are following Cloud BAdIs defined to provide more flexibility of control the copying process from a reference document to a sales document. 

  • Copying Requirements for Sales Documents (from Sales Documents) - SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_HEAD_SLS 
  • Copying Requirements for Sales Document Items (from Sales Documents) - SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_ITEM_SLS 
  • Copying Requirements for Sales Documents (from Billing Documents) - SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_HEAD_BIL
  • Copying Requirements for Sales Document Items (from Billing Documents) - SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_ITEM_BIL
  • Data Transfer for Sales Document Headers - SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_HEAD
  • Data Transfer for Sales Document Items - SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_ITEM

These BAdI implementations can be assigned into sales document copy control  SSCUIs as special routines, similar to what could be done in VOFM transactions in SAP ECC era. 

According to BAdI definition, these BAdIs support "multiple implementation". It means you can create multiple BAdI implementations and then assign them into different copy control scenarios. 

Normally, the "COPY_RQMT" BAdIs are used to check whether the reference document can be copied to a target document. When business criteria is not met via BAdI implementation, the copy process will be cancelled. The "DATA_TRANSFER" BAdIs are processed after the "COPY_RQMT" BAdI is passed. In "DATA_TRANSFER" BAdI implementation, it is possible to control the field mapping between source document and the target document. 

BAdI Parameters

There are following typical parameters in "COPY_RQMT" BAdIs:

Parameter NameDescriptionParameter TypePurpose
SALESDOCUMENTSales document headerImportingContains sales document header data that customer can use to decide if copy control is relevant
SALESDOCUMENTITEMSales document itemImportingContains sales document item data that customer can use to decide if copy control is relevant
MESSAGESMessages Changing Customer can raise messages when applicable 
SALESDOCUMENT_COPYCANCELCancel header copy controlChangingThis is the control field that customer can decide whether to cancel the copy process

There are following typical parameters in "DATA_TRANSFER" BAdIs:

Parameter NameDescriptionParameter TypePurpose
SALESDOCUMENT_INSales document headerImportingContains sales document header data that customer can use to decide if copy control is relevant
SALESDOCUMENTITEM_INSales document itemImportingContains sales document item data that customer can use to decide if copy control is relevant
MESSAGESMessages Changing Customer can raise messages when applicable 
SALESDOCUMENT_OUTSales document changeable fieldsChangingThis structure contains all changeable fields on sales document header level that could be copied to the target document
SALESDOCUMENTITEM_OUTSales document item changeable fieldsChanginghis structure contains all changeable fields on sales document item level that could be copied to the target document

Not all standard fields in sales document header and sales document item are changeable in "DATA_TRANSFER" BAdIs. Until release CE2602, following sales document header fields are changeable in BAdI SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_HEAD:

  • Purchase Order By Customer
  • Customer Purchase Order Date
  • Shipping Condition
  • SD Document Reason
  • Customer Purchase Order Type
  • Correspondence External Reference 

Following sales document item fields are changeable in BAdI SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_ITEM:

  • Purchase Order By Customer 
  • Sales Product Hierarchy Node Origin
  • Delivery Date Quantity is Fixed
  • Customer Purchase Order Type
  • Correspondence External Reference

The custom fields on sales document header and item level are also changeable fields in "DATA_TRANSFER" BAdIs. 

Business Example 

Supplier company XYZ always negotiates with buyers via sales quotation. Once sales quotation is approved, sales orders can be created by referring to a sales quotation. Company XYZ doesn't want to create sales orders from a sales quotation if the sales quotation is close to expiration, e.g. a sales quotation will be expired in 3 days. 

The supply company XYZ has a special sales process called "Export Order". The "Export Order" is always created by reference to a sales quotation. The supply company XYZ wants to utilize the standard field "Customer Purchase Order Type" to differentiate the "Export Order" from the normal sales orders. 

Solution via Extensibility

The copy control BAdIs can be used to fulfill above requirements from supply company XYZ. The BAdI SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_HEAD_SLS shall be implemented to check if the sales quotation is expired in 3 days and stop the copying process. The BAdI SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_HEAD shall be implemented to set the "Customer Purchase Order Type" when a sales order is created from a sales quotation. 

Implement BAdI to Cancel Copy When Sales Quotation is Expired Soon

Go to app "Custom Logic" to create a new BAdI implementation for BAdI "SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_HEAD_SLS".

Adding the filter "ENHANCEMENT_ID = QUOTE" as this BAdI allows multiple implementations. The enhancement ID can be used to identify the BAdI to be used in certain copy control entries. 

Create the BAdI implementation, and then define the custom logic.

* This BAdI checks the quotation validity period aginst to current order creation date.
* If the sales quotation is closed to experiation date, e.g. expire within 3 days,
* The sales order creation from sales quotation shall be stopped.
    if salesdocument-sddocumentcategory = 'B' and salesdocument-SALESORGANIZATION = '1710'.
        select * into table @DATA(lt_header) from i_salesquotation where salesquotation = @salesdocument-salesdocument.
        read table lt_header into data(ls_header) index 1.
        if sy-subrc = 0.
            salesdocument_copycancel = abap_false.
            data(ls_date) = cl_abap_context_info=>get_system_date( ). "get current date
            "make sure the sales quotation is still valid on current date.
            if ls_date >= ls_header-BindingPeriodValidityStartDate and ls_date <= ls_header-BindingPeriodValidityEndDate.
                data(ls_offset) = ls_header-BindingPeriodValidityEndDate - ls_date.
                if ls_offset < 3.
                    salesdocument_copycancel = abap_true.
                    "raise error message
                    data ls_msg like line of messages.
                    ls_msg-messagetype = 'E'.
                    ls_msg-messagetext = 'The sales quotation will be expired in ' && ls_offset && ' days, copied is not possible.'.
                    append ls_msg to messages.
                endif.
            else.
                salesdocument_copycancel = abap_true.
            endif.
        endif.
    endif.

Save and publish the BAdI logic. 

Open the app "Manage Your Solution" and open the SSCUI 103089 to define copy control routines. 

Create a new enhancement routine for BAdI "SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_HEAD_SLS".

Go to detail node to assign enhancement ID.

Save the configuration. 

Go to SSCUI 102905 to assign this routine into copy control setting from sales quotation to sales order.

Assign the copy control requirement routine.

Test the behavior of creating sales orders from the sales quotation which is going to be expired in 3 days. 

There is a sales quotation valid from Nov 1st to Nov 12th. 

 

Create a sales order with reference to this sales quotation. 

After press button "Continue", error message is raised based on BAdI implementation logic. 

The copy control requirement BAdI can be used to stop copying process when certain business rules are not met. 

Implement BAdI to Determine Purchase Order Type in Sales Order

In order to fulfill the requirement to determine purchase order type when sales orders are created from a sales quotation, the BAdI "SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_HEAD" can be implemented to set purchase order type. 

Firstly, go to SSCUI 103394 to define new purchase order type for "Export Order".

Define a new purchase order type "EXPO" for "Export Order".

Save the entry.

Go to app "Custom Logic" to create a new BAdI implementation for BAdI "SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_HEAD".

In the BAdI implementation, add following custom logic to set customer purchase order type.

*   This method can be used to enhance the SAP standard copy control
*   from sales document to sales document and from billing document to sales document.

*   First of all assign existing field values to output parameter:
    move-corresponding salesdocument_in to salesdocument_out.

    if salesdocument_in-referencesddocumentcategory = 'B'.
        salesdocument_out-customerpurchaseordertype = 'EXPO'.
    endif.

Publish the BAdI implementation. 

Go to SSCUI 103089 to define new routine for above copy control BAdI implementation.

In the detail node, assign enhancement ID to this routine.

Then go to SSCUI 102905 to assign this routine 3000093 to the copy control entry. 

Save the configuration. 

There is a sales quotation which is valid until end of 2025.

Create a sales order with reference to this sales quotation.

After click "Continue" button, system navigates to the sales order creation page.

The purchase order type "EXPO" is defaulted based on custom logic in BAdI implementation. 

Moving Forward

The copy control BAdIs provide flexibility to influence sales document copying processes. They can control whether creating from reference is relevant or how fields are mapped from the source document to the target document.

However, not all sales document data is exposed as parameter in those BAdIs, and not all standard fields are changeable during the copying process. We will continue to invest in this direction to bring more flexibility to the copying process.

On the other hand, we also expect customers can raise requirement if any field is missing during copying. Please feel free to submit your requirement through the Customer Influence Portal, see detail in SAP note 2963059. Stay tuned for new features planned in our roadmap.

entry.title: Using Custom Logic in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to restrict multiple parkings of supplier invoices
entry.content:
Problem Background:

A customer has requested a requirement to restrict the repeated parking of goods receipt reference documents and reference document items corresponding to purchase orders that have already been parked and posted. If a purchase order has already completed goods receipt, reference document, and invoice posting, it should no longer be possible to park an invoice for this purchase order.

Solution:

Attempt to meet the requirement through custom logic using a BAdI.

Analysis Steps:

1. We have previously assisted customers with invoicing requirements, and the business enhancement points we need to use are the same. You can refer to these two blogs: Using Custom Logic in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to check if the payment terms of pre made invoices are consistent with those in supplier master data | SAP Blogs and Using Custom Logic in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to restrict invoicing of purchase orders with incomplete receipts | SAP Blogs .

First, we need to add an enhancement implementation in the application - Custom Logic of SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. According to the business scenario, select the business context Procurement: Supplier Invoice and business add-in description Check Invoice Data, and fill in the implementation description and implementation identifier.

2. After adding the enhancement implementation in Custom Logic, we need to find the CDS Views that can provide the business requirement fields. After testing, for the same PO + ITEM + goods receipt, if it has already been posted, the same goods receipt document cannot be selected again for repeated parking. Therefore, the fields I use as validation conditions here are PO and ITEM numbers. At the same time, since we need to check whether this PO and ITEM have already been posted, we need to use SUPPLIERINVOICESTATUS = '5' in I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01. However, this CDS View does not have the PO and ITEM fields, so we need to use I_SuplrInvcItemPurOrdRefAPI01. In the sample code below, I used a custom CDS View. You can create a custom CDS View YY1_I_SUPPLIERINVOICEAPI01 in your own system based on I_SupplierInvoiceAPI01, select the corresponding fields, and make adjustments.

At the same time, as I mentioned in my previous articles, in the sample code provided by the BAdI, we can find statements that can restrict the behavior that triggers the BAdI. According to our needs, we need to add the following statement to restrict the BAdI to only trigger during invoice parking, without affecting other processes:

Park: if_ex_mrm_check_invoice_cloud=>c_Action_Park

3. Based on the above analysis, implement the BAdI. The specific code is as follows.

loop at ITEMSWITHPOREFERENCE REFERENCE INTO DATA(Supinvoice_item).
if action = if_ex_mrm_check_invoice_cloud=>c_Action_Hold.
    select single 
    from YY1_I_SUPPLIERINVOICEAPI01 with privileged access
    where PURCHASEORDER = @Supinvoice_item->PURCHASEORDER and PURCHASEORDERITEM = @Supinvoice_item->PURCHASEORDERITEM
    and SUPPLIERINVOICESTATUS = '5'
    into (Is_Supinvoice_status) .
    if Is_Supinvoice_status = abap_true.
      append value #( messagetype = 'E' messageid = 'MRM_BADI_CLOUD' messagenumber = '001' messagevariable1 = '暂存的发票有重复项目。' ) to messages.
    endif.
endif.
endloop.

Conclusion:

By reading this article and several previous blogs on similar scenarios, I hope you now understand how to use custom logic to apply certain restrictions when creating preliminary invoices for purchase orders.
You can find more information about SAP S/4HANA Cloud procurement-related issues at the following link: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement - SAP Community

You can also read more blogs about SAP S/4HANA Cloud procurement at the following link: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement - SAP Community

If you have any suggestions or thoughts about this article, please feel free to share them in the comments section. I look forward to communicating with you. You are also welcome to follow my personal account, and I look forward to seeing you in the next blog post!

entry.title: 借助 Data Source Extension 将更重要的业务信息字段显示在 Fiori App 中
entry.content:
技术简介

Data Source Extension / 数据源扩展 / 資料來源延伸 是 SAP ERP 云中一项重要的关键用户可扩展性应用。其基本技术原理为，基于某一项系统标准预制的“Business Context / 业务上下文 / 業務內容”，关键用户将系统标准提供的更多数据字段或自定义字段添加其中，进而通过“Adapt UI / UI 调整模式 / 調整使用者介面”使这些字段在对应的 Fiori App 中显示出来。

应用场景

S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 中各 Fiori App 的标准设计参考了更广泛的客户与行业应用诉求。若您的企业在个性化管理的诉求中，业务用户关注的字段并未在 SAP 标准设计中得以呈现，作为系统实施方或关键用户，您即可通过本文介绍的技术手段将这些字段呈现到 Fiori App 中。

实例讲解

业务背景

当采购员使用 Post Goods Movement / 过账货物移动 / 過帳物料異動（MIGO）App 进行收货时，可以在“Supplier Batch / 供应商批次 / 供應商批次”字段中填入供应商方的货品批次号。该字段会被 SAP ERP 云系统记录，并可被用于后续的溯源需求。在 Web GUI App MIGO 中回看货物移动凭证时，可以在“Batch / 批次”页签中，点击“Classification / 分类 / 分類”按钮，在弹窗中的“Basic Data 1 / 基本数据 / 基本資料”页签中查看到 Supplier Batch 信息。

但若用户使用新的 Fiori App Material Documents Overview / 物料凭证概览 / 物料文件概觀（F1077）查看已创建的货物移动凭证，标准 UI 中却无法找到此 Supplier Batch 的信息。

解决方案

实施方或具有相关权限的关键用户可以在配置实施环境（三系统架构 D/100，或两系统架构 Q/100）中，按以下步骤完成相关设定，并传输至生产环境供终端用户使用。

步骤 1：在 Custom Fields / 自定义字段 / 自訂欄位 App 中，为数据源“Material Document Items (Display) / 物料凭证项目（显示）/ 物料文件項目〈顯示〉”增加 Supplier Batch 字段。

1) 打开 Custom Fields App，点击页签“Data Source Extensions / 数据源扩展 / 資料來源延伸”。点击右侧按钮 + ，创建一个新的 Data Source Extension。

  • Data Source / 数据源 / 資料來源：选择编码为 MMIM_MATDOC_OV_SRV 的数据源。
  • Description / 描述 / 說明：填写该增强的应用场景说明，如“Supplier Batch” 。
  • Extension ID / 扩展标识 / 延伸 ID：系统会依据您填写的 Description 自动生成一个关键用户增强编码，您也可以手动调整。

2) 填写完信息后，点击“Create / 创建 / 建立”，系统会导览至该增强的编辑页面。点击页签“Field Selection / 字段选择 / 欄位選取”。从左侧的“Available Fields / 可用字段 / 可用欄位”中依次展开“Find Material Document Items / 查找物料凭证项目 / 尋找物料文件項目” > “Batch Information / 批次信息 / 批次資訊”。接着从列表中勾选字段 Supplier Batch，您会看到选中的字段被添加到了右侧的“Selected Fields / 所选字段 / 所選欄位”清单中。您可以调整“Field Name / 字段名称 / 欄位名稱”，或采用系统默认设定的字段名。确认无误后，点击右下角的按钮“Publish / 发布 / 發佈” 以部署该增强。

请注意，这一步骤并未在系统数据库的物理表中新增自定义字段，只是将数据源中的字段补充在了前端调用的接口中。

步骤2：在 Material Documents Overview App 的凭证显示页面中，将数据源中补充的 Supplier Batch 字段显示出来。

1) 打开 Material Documents Overview App，从结果清单中点击打开任一凭证的详情页面。

2) 停留在该页面中，点击右上角的人形按钮，再点击“Adapt UI / UI 调整模式 / 調整使用者介面”选项进入该程序页面的 UI 调整模式。

3) 单击页面中您想要展示 Supplier Batch 的区块，例如 Document Notes，在弹窗中点击“Add: Field / 添加：字段 / 新增：欄位”。

4) 在弹窗中，搜索 Supplier Batch，您将能看到在前序步骤中新增的数据源字段 Supplier Batch。选中该字段，并点击“OK / 确定 / 確定”。您将看到该字段成功地显示在了该 App 页面上。您还可以拖拽该字段以调整其显示的位置。

5) 对于该 App 页面的修改，您可以点击右上角的磁盘图标进行保存。若您确认已完成调整，需要点击左上角的激活按钮，输入一个增强版本说明后，点击“Confirm / 确认 / 確認”。最后点击左上角的发布按钮，系统将开始在后台为您发布这一变更，使当前系统环境下所有用户均可看到这一变更。

6) 最后，点击右上角的 X 按钮，退出该程序页面的 UI 调整模式。到此，您就完成了所有的调整设定，实现了该业务需求。

总结

在 SaaS 软件服务中，除了依托标准产品的创新交付获取新的业务功能外，S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 也提供了例如 Data Source Extension 这样简捷、无代码的可扩展性，供关键用户或实施方快速地调整 Fiori App 的页面信息字段与布局呈现。

若针对您的业务场景所需的数据源，系统尚未提供目标业务上下文或源字段供个性化调整，您可以将相关诉求提至 SAP Customer Influence Portal。SAP 产品开发团队将依据广大的客户群体反馈，持续迭代创新。
